comments.body: turbio pero facisante
Wow, you predicted the future of the Torchflower! I do hope these glowing mechanics get to be added to the torchflower as we could use more lighting.

I think it would be really cool if it had a light level of 1 or maybe 2. This would be cool because it would allow for a field of grass glowing in the darkness, rather than a field of grass lighting up it's surroundings (so it would stop mob spawns, but only barely... for cosmetic purposes) 

I also think it would need to come with it's own grass-block, like mycelium or podzol.
Most biomes just have poppies and dandelions though. Only specific biomes have unique ones, so that would leave fewer options.
Wow, I think that's great idea!
No, it's not meant to be like other mounts. Those with storage is their unique benefit, while camels already have their own benefits. It's for game balance.
Ou des coffre

That sounds cool but i don't think it should be a big root block like mangrove roots, it should just be one root block that looks like muddy dirt but with roots in the texture right underneath the tree. Or it could be multiple, it just shouldnt be as much as mangroves have.
At the very least 1 rooted dirt block should generate underneath them.
What if they were hard to distinguish from a similar edible mushroom? That could be an interesting challenge...
I want new cap

Diamonds are useless once you've got fully enchanted gear, so they just sit in storage gathering dust. Diamonds are extremely easy to obtain nowadays, you can get a lot just by exploring structures, no need to even go mining.
I agree, either make them reusable or have the duplication recipe made from renewable items.

i feel that diamonds are relatively easy to get from the new cave generation, but for something purely aesthetic it shouldn't be that tedious to duplicate the trims. then again i don't know what would be used in place of diamond

diamonds are easy to get yes , but you have all said "at endgame". this idea says early game and even so its still expensive . im not gonna waste my life finding that many diamonds to dupe an amour trim.

I agree. I dislike this change. The potions looked so much cooler with the enchantment glint and currently we have no way to make any item have the enchantment glint by default, this feature is hardcoded. There should either be an accessibility option specifically for the enchantment glint on potions or there should be a way to customise this with resource packs. Note that not all types of potions had the enchantment glint, the normal glass bottles and awkward potions etc. didn't display the enchantment glint. It feels also inconsistent that potions don't display it anymore, while experience bottles still do. Experience bottles can be thrown the same way as splash potions and lingering potions. I understand, that the glint made it harder to distinguish them but that wasn't that big of an issue for me. I was still able to distinguish them when I needed to. 
Instead of making this a simple toggle, maybe make this a slider that is like the Glint Strength accessibiltiy option but only applies for the potions. That way you could only partially have the enchantment glint if you like it while still wanting to have it easier to distinguish the potions.

It would be best if you made this into "Potion Visual Accessibility Settings," considering both the glint and the new potion color changes have been made. Unfortunately, quite several people still don't like them, even with time. Same premise, but I would organize it like this so that it's easier to read and people can follow this better.

"There should be settings for both the potion enchantment glint and new potion color changes in Accessibility settings. Several players I've seen, even if it's smaller than the more welcoming players to the changes, would still like the original look of the potions, either for personal preference or other purposes.

Proposed changes:
- New Accessibility Settings: Potion Enchantment Glint -> [On/Off]
- New Accessibility Settings: Potion Colors -> [Default/Old/Red-Green Colorblind/Blue-Yellow Colorbind]
(I added colorblind changes for players who are colorblind since removing the glint in the first place made it harder for some colorblind people to distinguish them easily from other bottled items. The new potion colors should still be default since you are committing to this change, and make the old settings an option.)"

Overall, these settings could benefit more from the "Quality of Life" aspect of the update and 1.19.4 and future versions of bedrock, especially for players who still want the old potion settings.

This is an amazing idea! Just imagine sniffer to change its colour upon entering a biome. As my favorite grass variant is the one found in The Cherry Blossom biome, I really want to see the sniffer in that colour.  ITS SO AMAZING!
imagine colorblind people seeing same colors on sniffer all red, yellow, yellow
being able to fill the pots with water would also be good
I love the idea but thinking about the real-life uses of pots in that size it would make better sense for it to be used for liquid storage purposes
Double tall plants should be able to be planted in decorated pots!
I think they should add the possibility to put 2 blocks-flowers on these decorated pots. There's no other way to place them on regular pots. I would give those flowers new uses.

Would be a fun early game alternative to the shulker box. Maybe if you’re carrying it and take damage, the pot would break, but it can carry more items than one chest, so you would have to be careful while exploring with it?
No, not with both hands, that would be difficult to animate, more work for the overworked devs

Yes, large mosquito opponents in the jungle and swamps are a great idea.
First, there will be more need for the "Bane of Arthropods" enchantment. Secondly, they will be part of the ecosystem, being food for frogs.
